sub_title: Artistic Director I Choreographer & Dancer I Teacher
summary:
As a choreographer, dance artist and educator I love to speak through movement. I aim to capture a strong image or idea and play with its movement and rhythm.

Stories and concepts can have all kinds of forms and shapes. In my artistic approaches, I notice there is space between the lines for the unsaid and the own imagination. That's where art creates another place to meet. Looking from this point of view, I try to let daily life meet with the imaginary and with each other. I work with dance/movement and video.

In my choreographic way of working I initiate concepts and invite other artists to join and co-create. Besides my choreographic work under the project-based dance company Sanne Clifford & Co, I'm also co-founder and artistic co-director of Choreolab Europe, a platform for choreographic research. 

I am able to bring a creative and analytical mindset combined with a positive attitude, I enjoy working with new challenges, different perspectives, collaborations and ways to bring artistic theory and practice together. Summed up, I love to move, collaborate, teach and learn!

Feel free to contact me for a chat, discussion and/or collaboration.
www.sanneclifford.nl - info@sanneclifford.nl - www.choreolab.eu

projects.title: Crossing Currents
projects.description:
How flexible can we remain in an always moving, ever changing scenery? Four dancers test their own and each other's (in)exhaustible adaptability in this interdisciplinary dance performance by Sanne Clifford & Talitha Schiffer.

Credits:
Concept & creation: Sanne Clifford & Talitha Schiffer
Choreography: Sanne Clifford
Dance: Sanne Clifford, Anastasia Kostner, Sandra Kramerova & Teresa Santos
Composition/music: Jeske de Blauw
Artistic coaching: Pia Meuthen
Decor/Parts concept: Talitha Schiffer
Light design: Ellen Knops
Photography: Rashel van der Schaaf
Production: Sanne Clifford & Co
 
Crossing Currents is supported by: NORMA Feniks Fonds, Amsterdam Fonds voor de Kunst, Alkmaar Maakt Het!, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds Noord-Holland, BIM Projects, Gravin van Bylandt Stichting en Stichting Sanne Clifford & Co.

Beeldend Kunstenaar, Coördinator Kunstschool bij Artiance - Centrum voor de Kunsten

projects.title: Anam Cara (Soul Friend)
projects.description:
EN: Anam Cara (Soul Friend) shows an intimate meeting between the self and another as a mirror reflecting what we recognize of ourselves in the other. This poetic duet with live music will create an environment of co-existence, where the audience surrounds the dancers in a circle.

NL: Anam Cara (Soul Friend) is een poëtisch duet over kwetsbaar mogen zijn, herkenning vinden in de ander en op eigen benen staan. Choreografen en performers Sanne Clifford en Anastasia Kostner dansen in een intieme ruimte omcirkeld door publiek. Ze maken contact met elkaar en, op afstand, met hun omgeving. Hierbij worden ze ondersteund door live muziek door Amir Swaab (percussie/accordeon) en Hadewych van Gent (cello).

Trailer: 
https://vimeo.com/457693589

Choreografie en dans: Sanne Clifford, Anastasia Kostner
Muziek: Amir Swaab, Hadewych van Gent
Dramaturgische coaching: Freek Duinhof
Lichtontwerp: Ellen Knops

Deze voorstelling wordt mede mogelijk gemaakt door: NORMA fonds, Cultuurmakersfonds, Prins Bernhard Cultuurfonds Noord-Holland en Stichting Ben Remkes Cultuurfonds.

contributors.headline: Artistic Director I Choreographer & Dancer I Teacher

projects.title: Mind your Step
projects.description:
In 'Mind your step' dance artist Sanne Clifford explores her freedom of movement within 1,5 square meters. The current adjustments of keeping physical distance in daily life have an effect on how we move and respond to each other. What does the body have to say to this?

Trailer: https://vimeo.com/458666791

contributors.headline: Artistic Director I Choreographer & Dancer I Teacher

projects.title: Voice of Void
projects.description:
Inspired by the different paces of nature versus urban environments and the feeling of insignificance a grand landscape can evoke. Voice of Void zooms in on the influences of our surroundings in daily life and how it effects our inner world. 

This visual choreography / dancing installation by Sanne Clifford (choreographer) and Manon Veldhuis (scenographer) highlights the contrast between these two environments we live in. They can provide stability or reason to adjust. The dancers move and respond to the rhythms of this changing landscape. Experience a mesmerizing game of different paces and unfolding patterns through movement, breath and an ongoing changing scenery.
 
Concept: Sanne Clifford & Manon Veldhuis
Choreography: Sanne Clifford
Scenography: Manon Veldhuis
Music: Amir Swaab
Dance & co-creation:
Fabiana Carchesio, Fernanda Gonzalez Morales, Candela Murillo & 
Amber Smits/Sanne Clifford.

projects.title: NOTE TO SELF
projects.description:
Eye to eye, getting closer and closer. NOTE TO SELF is an inviting dance performance about the daily-life struggle how to balance our ongoing to-do lists with a longing search for silence.
Find four dancers in a landscape of post-its, onliners and mesmerizing beats. 

Concept & choreography: Sanne Clifford
​Dance: Sandra Kramerova, Mayke van Veldhuizen, Fabiana Carchesio & Fernando Oliveira
Music: Amir Swaab
Costume design: Nanda Groen
Dramaturgy: Jordi Ribot Thunnissen
Light design: Ellen Knops

projects.title: We are the everlasting guests
projects.description:
Three dancers and three musicians start a journey about the restless human being, seeking 'the right to stay’. Their quest combines instinctive and intuitive responses and habits, while attempting to find solid ground, and trustful connection among each other.

​This group of performers is brought together by initiators Sanne Clifford (choreographer) and Iman Spaargaren (composer). They invited Guillermo Celano (guitar), Hayley Adams (dance), Robin van Rhijn (drums) and Camilla Bundel (dance) to join the project and have been collaborating and co-creating since. Dramaturgy and coaching is in the hands of Jordi Ribot Thunnissen.

Choreography & dance:
Sanne Clifford, Hayley Adams & Camilla Bundel

Composition & music:
Iman Spaargaren, Guillermo Celano & Robin van Rhijn

Dramaturgy:
Jordi Ribot Thunnissen

projects.title: 3 is a crowd
projects.description:
A site-specific dance performance where slightly changing situations reveal moments of awkwardness, harmony, dependence and separation, while longing for connection. When do we really need each other and where does it go wrong? Three dancers research how to connect and disconnect with each other, the space and their audience.

Concept & choreography: Sanne Clifford
Dance & co-creation: Hayley Adams, Sanne Clifford & Anastasia Kostner
Dramaturgy/coaching: Jordi Ribot Thunnissen
Photography: Alexander van der Linden, Sjoerd Derine & Mounir Chadli
Music: Amir Swaab

3, 4 & 5 March 2017, Café Theater Festival, Utrecht
22 & 23 April 2017, Oostblok Theater, Amsterdam
'Reverb & Residue' I Radion, Amsterdam
5 June 2017, Vuurol Festival, Lage Vuursche
20 July 2017, SALON/E BRUNECK BRUNICO 2017, Italy

You can read a Dutch review**** by Boukje Cnossen here:
https://www.theaterkrant.nl/recensie/3-is-a-crowd/sanne-clifford/

projects.title: Mira Mira
projects.description:
'Mira Mira' is a solo performance about looking at Mira and Mira looking back at the world, at her audience. Influences from outside versus the open and vulnerable inside. We questioned ourselves: What do you show of yourself? What if nobody is looking, or you are looked at all the time?
Mira looks, sees the inviting challenges around herself. She is preparing herself, getting ready to make a change without settling for less.

Choreography: Sanne Clifford
Dance: Miroljuba Petrova

projects.title: Never grow up (solo & duet)
projects.description:
First I created a solo about a moment of making up the balance being 30-something, finding yourself between looking back and forward; driven with new desires drawn from explored solid ground, keeping in mind to never really grow up. Let’s go from here.

Later the duet was created and danced in collaboration with Jordi Ribot Thunnissen.

projects.title: Lean on
projects.description:
I created a duet based on a relationship and connection of two sisters, meeting themes such as: trust, unconditional love and support, playfulness, being annoyed and the need for your own space.

projects.description:
I created and performed the choreography 'W/W' in collaboration with Fabiana Carchesio & Nika Jankovic. Dramaturgy: Jordi Ribot Thunnissen.

A 20 minute work about women, who sometimes feel the lines between their inner sides are getting thinner and thinner; From wolves to warriors and back to women.

projects.title: Cocoon
projects.description:
Does the way in which you perceive yourself and how others perceive you resemble the person you are today? Layer upon layer of first impressions, choices and changes you made, have been formed in the years passing by. 

Layers of plastic like a second skin. They are transparent, strong and vulnerable at the same time. Do they give enough space to breathe or do you need to peel those layers off to see who you are today?

Four dancers struggle with those thoughts. Taking a step away from blending in daily life, they search for their own identity that fits today.

Performances at:
27 augustus 2011 - Blikopener 2011 - Delft
www.blikopener.net - 16.00h, 18.00h & 19.30h

2 september 2011 - Temporary Art Centre T.A.C. - Eindhoven
www.hallocultuur.nl - 20.30h & 21.30h

4 september 2011 - Temporary Art Centre T.A.C. - Eindhoven
www.hallocultuur.nl - 14.30h & 16.00h

16 september 2011 - Incubate/Open Source Dance - Tilburg
http://incubate.org/2011/event/5 - 19.50h (short version: 10 min.)

profile_positions.description:
As an independent choreographer & dance artist I (co-)create dance and movement performances and film, coming from contrasts and similarities in daily life that draw my attention. Together with my artistic collaborators, our approaches come from the physical and/or visual perspective. I aim to connect with different types of dancers, performers, other (art)disciplines and sites. For example I have created for theatre settings, site-specific, festivals and dance film and I collaborated with unique dancers, multimedia artists, composers, a spoken word artist and many more. 

More information can be found (in English) on: www.sanneclifford.nl
profile_positions.title: Independent Choreographer & Dance Artist

profile_positions.description: Part of the team at ArtEZ Bachelor of Dance in Education, teaching, coaching and supervising students, co-creating and developing the curriculum, coordinating projects, and more.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator, Teacher & Supervisor at Bachelor Dance in Education

profile_positions.location: Amsterdam Area, Netherlands & Berne area, Switzerland
profile_positions.description:
Choreolab Europe is an international and collaborative artistic research platform for dance and choreography. It provides an artistic playground for choreographers, dancers and movers from all over the world, where specific ideas on creation for movement and performance are researched in a peer-to-peer setting.

In the form of 4-day intensives, Choreolab Europe organizes labs in different European cities. each lab offers a combination of diverse activities. 

Choreolab Europe was founded in 2015 by artistic directors Sanne Clifford and Anja Gallagher, who met in 2014 and have been working together since.  

Choreolab Europe has been facilitated in a.o. Amsterdam, Arnhem, Basel, Barcelona, Berlin, Berne, Dublin and Lisbon.

More information: www.choreolab.eu
profile_positions.title: Artistic Director & Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
With a passion for movement and the aim to keep growing as creative movers, thinkers and artists, MADE4MOTION combines the moving body and creative mind into a holistic lifestyle that is possible to live by in a maintaining & gentle challenging way. Listening to what the body tells us and creating space for our ideas (without blocking them right away by fear or overload), we aim to facilitate support for healthy and fun ways of creating awareness and positive change.

www.made4motion.nl
